metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29154 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
BPF JIT compilers in the Linux kernel through 5.11.12 have incorrectcomputation of branch displacements, allowing them to execute arbitrarycode within the kernel context. This affects arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp.cand arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp32.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-209.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1092.101
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1127.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1099.106~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1113.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1098.111~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1070.78~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1151-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1151.162
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1155.165
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-209.241').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1092.101').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.141').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.106~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1113.126~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.111~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1070.78~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1151.162').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.165').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
